page.title: 10RAVEDEN WOOD
page.content: Off Moss Bank Way there is a wood called Raveden Wood.Inside it there are a lot of wild flowers like Daisies,Buttercups and Bluebells.The Brook is not really very clean,because the iron in the water makes it orange. The paths have arrows on to show you where to go.There are some bridges over the brooks which are made out of stone or metal.The river is not fast flowing and it runs in different directions. Through the woods we got to two schools Smithills Comprehensive and the Sixth Form College.We saw a pond which wasn't very safe.The sides were steep and it wasn't fenced off.There is a cub hut which always gets vandalised.It is made of wood and it does not look nice at all.
